title: Russia-Ukraine War
description: Ongoing since February 2022, this conflict involves Russia's invasion of Ukraine, leading to significant territorial disputes, international sanctions, and widespread humanitarian crises.
casualties: Tens of thousands of military and civilian casualties.
displacement: Over 8 million Ukrainians displaced within Europe.
basic_info: Conflict began with Russia's annexation of Crimea in 2014, escalating into full invasion in 2022. The war has prompted extensive global political and economic impacts.

title: Israeli-Palestinian Conflict
description: A long-standing conflict over territorial claims, national recognition, and sovereignty, recently intensified by escalations in Gaza and the West Bank.
casualties: Thousands of casualties on both sides over decades.
basic_info: Roots of the conflict trace back to the early 20th century, with ongoing disputes over land and rights leading to periodic violence.

title: Yemeni Civil War
description: Since 2014, Yemen has been embroiled in a civil war between the Houthi movement and the internationally recognized government, leading to a severe humanitarian crisis.
casualties: Over 377,000 deaths (both direct and indirect causes).
displacement: More than 4 million people internally displaced.
basic_info: Conflict has created one of the worldâ€™s worst humanitarian crises, with widespread famine and health issues.

title: Syrian Civil War
description: Beginning in 2011, this multi-sided conflict involves the Syrian government, various rebel groups, ISIS, and international actors, resulting in massive displacement and casualties.
displacement: Over 6.6 million internally displaced and 5.6 million refugees worldwide.
basic_info: Sparked by the Arab Spring protests, the conflict has escalated into a complex proxy war involving regional and global powers.
